clinical_study.brief_title: The Standing and Sitting Spino-pelvic Sagittal Alignment in Chinese Population
clinical_study.official_title: The Standing and Sitting Spino-pelvic Sagittal Alignment in Chinese Population

brief_summary.textblock: This study is aimed to demonstrate the standing and sitting spino-pelvic sagittal alignment in Chinese population, then to explore the influence of spinal fusion on the changes when moving from standing to sitting positon.

primary_outcome.measure: Group 2 The sagittal spinal parameters in degrees
primary_outcome.description: The parameters included TPA (T1 pelvic angle,the angle between the line from the axis of the femoral head to the center of T1 and the line from the axis of the femoral head to the midpoint of the S1 endplate), lumbar lordosis (LL,the angle between the upper endplate of L1 and S1), thoracic kyphosis (TK,The angle between the upper endplate of T4 and the lower endplate of T12), pelvic incidence (PI,The angle between the line perpendicular to the midpoint of the sacral plate and the line connecting this to the midpoint of the hip axis), pelvic tilt (PT,The angle between the line from the middle of the sacral plate to the middle of the hip axis and the vertical line), sacral slope (SS,The angle between the sacral endplate and the horizontal line)

primary_outcome.measure: Group 1 The sagittal spinal parameters in degrees
primary_outcome.description: The parameters included TPA (T1 pelvic angle,the angle between the line from the axis of the femoral head to the center of T1 and the line from the axis of the femoral head to the midpoint of the S1 endplate), lumbar lordosis (LL,the angle between the upper endplate of L1 and S1), thoracic kyphosis (TK,The angle between the upper endplate of T4 and the lower endplate of T12), pelvic incidence (PI,The angle between the line perpendicular to the midpoint of the sacral plate and the line connecting this to the midpoint of the hip axis), pelvic tilt (PT,The angle between the line from the middle of the sacral plate to the middle of the hip axis and the vertical line), sacral slope (SS,The angle between the sacral endplate and the horizontal line)

primary_outcome.measure: Group 1 The sagittal spinal parameters in millimeter
primary_outcome.description: SVA (sagittal vertical axis, The offset between the center of C7 and the plumb line drawn from posterosuperior corner of S1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Group 2 Disability assessed by the Oswestry Disability Index (ODI)
secondary_outcome.description: The Oswestry Disability Index (ODI) (0-100) is used to assess disability.Higher scores mean a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Group 2 Back pain assessed by the VAS
secondary_outcome.description: The Visual Analog Scale (0-10) is used to evaluate back pain.Higher scores mean a worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Group 2 Leg pain assessed by the VAS
secondary_outcome.description: The Visual Analog Scale (0-10) is used to evaluate leg pain.Higher scores mean a worse outcome.

arm_group.description: the middle-aged and elderly Chinese asymptomatic population who underwent the whole spine X-ray in standing and sitting positions.
the patients who underwent posterior lumbar fusion surgery for lumbar degenerative disease has been followed up for three months.

intervention.description: Group 1 underwent whole spine X-ray in standing and sitting positions.

study_pop.textblock: Healthy Volunteers Patients with lumbar degenerative disease who had undergone surgery in Peking university third hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Group 1 90 Healthy Volunteers - age >40 years, no history of neck pain, back pain, or radicular pain in the previous six months, no history of chronic neck or back pain lasting more than three months, no history of spinal disease or surgery, no spinal deformity or lumbar spondylolisthesis, no history of hip or knee arthroplasty or other realignment surgery of the lower extremities, and no history of neuromuscular disorders.
Group 2 126 patients Clinical diagnosis of Lumbar degenerative disease
Exclusion Criteria:
Group 1 90 Healthy Volunteers
- pregnant
Group 2 126 patients
- Neuromuscular diseases
- Arthritis
- Tumor
- A previous history of lumbar fusion surgery
